intro: Austronea, commonly known as the Australian flame tree, is a striking tropical plant native to Australia. It belongs to the genus Brachylecium and is characterized by its large, fiery red flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has a spreading canopy and can grow up to 15 meters tall, making it a prominent feature in its natural habitat. Its leaves are compound, consisting of multiple leaflets, and it produces small, woody pods that contain its seeds. Austronea thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in coastal areas and along roadsides.
